intro: Tetranthera hypoglauca, commonly known as the glaucous tetranthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and the presence of glandular hairs on its foliage. Tetranthera hypoglauca is often found in association with other understory plants in tropical and subtropical regions.
